verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%>, Altaschith <S%H516><s%>, Michtam <S%H4387><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>; when Saul <S%H7586><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%>, and they watched <S%H8104><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> to kill him <S%H4191><s%>. Deliver <S%H5337><s%> me from mine enemies <S%H341><s%>, O my God <S%H430><s%>: defend <S%H7682><s%> me from them that rise up <S%H6965><s%> against me. Altaschith: or, To the chief Musician, destroy not, a golden Psalm of David defend: Heb. set me on high
Deliver <S%H5337><s%> me from the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%>, and save <S%H3467><s%> me from bloody <S%H1818><s%> men <S%H582><s%>.

For, lo, they lie in wait <S%H693><s%> for my soul <S%H5315><s%>: the mighty <S%H5794><s%> are gathered <S%H1481><s%> against me; not for my transgression <S%H6588><s%>, nor for my sin <S%H2403><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>.
They run <S%H7323><s%> and prepare <S%H3559><s%> themselves without my fault <S%H5771><s%>: awake <S%H5782><s%> to help <S%H7125><s%> me, and behold <S%H7200><s%>. help: Heb. meet

Thou therefore, O LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>, the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, awake <S%H6974><s%> to visit <S%H6485><s%> all the heathen <S%H1471><s%>: be not merciful <S%H2603><s%> to any wicked <S%H205><s%> transgressors <S%H898><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>.
They return <S%H7725><s%> at evening <S%H6153><s%>: they make a noise <S%H1993><s%> like a dog <S%H3611><s%>, and go round about <S%H5437><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%>.
Behold, they belch out <S%H5042><s%> with their mouth <S%H6310><s%>: swords <S%H2719><s%> are in their lips <S%H8193><s%>: for who, say they, doth hear <S%H8085><s%>?
But thou, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, shalt laugh <S%H7832><s%> at them; thou shalt have all the heathen <S%H1471><s%> in derision <S%H3932><s%>.
Because of his strength <S%H5797><s%> will I wait <S%H8104><s%> upon thee: for God <S%H430><s%> is my defence <S%H4869><s%>. defence: Heb. high place
The God <S%H430><s%> of my mercy <S%H2617><s%> shall prevent <S%H6923><s%> me: God <S%H430><s%> shall let me see <S%H7200><s%> my desire upon mine enemies <S%H8324><s%>. enemies: Heb. observers

Slay <S%H2026><s%> them not, lest my people <S%H5971><s%> forget <S%H7911><s%>: scatter <S%H5128><s%> them by thy power <S%H2428><s%>; and bring them down <S%H3381><s%>, O Lord <S%H136><s%> our shield <S%H4043><s%>.

For the sin <S%H2403><s%> of their mouth <S%H6310><s%> and the words <S%H1697><s%> of their lips <S%H8193><s%> let them even be taken <S%H3920><s%> in their pride <S%H1347><s%>: and for cursing <S%H423><s%> and lying <S%H3585><s%> which they speak <S%H5608><s%>.

Consume <S%H3615><s%> them in wrath <S%H2534><s%>, consume <S%H3615><s%> them, that they may not be: and let them know <S%H3045><s%> that God <S%H430><s%> ruleth <S%H4910><s%> in Jacob <S%H3290><s%> unto the ends <S%H657><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>.
And at evening <S%H6153><s%> let them return <S%H7725><s%>; and let them make a noise <S%H1993><s%> like a dog <S%H3611><s%>, and go round about <S%H5437><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%>.

Let them wander up and down <S%H5128><s%> <S%H5128><s%> for meat <S%H398><s%>, and grudge <S%H3885><s%> if they be not satisfied <S%H7646><s%>. for meat: Heb. to eat and grudge: or, if they be not satisfied, then they will stay all night

But I will sing <S%H7891><s%> of thy power <S%H5797><s%>; yea, I will sing aloud <S%H7442><s%> of thy mercy <S%H2617><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%>: for thou hast been my defence <S%H4869><s%> and refuge <S%H4498><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of my trouble <S%H6862><s%>.
Unto thee, O my strength <S%H5797><s%>, will I sing <S%H2167><s%>: for God <S%H430><s%> is my defence <S%H4869><s%>, and the God <S%H430><s%> of my mercy <S%H2617><s%>.
